hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Regulatory News Shock Absorption
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regime with low volatility (BTC 20-day realized vol < 40th percentile), if a major regulatory headline (e.g., MiCA enforcement, US legislation) triggers a >6% drop within 2 hours, and price fails to recover 50% of the drop within 24 hours, shorting the bounce to prior support will profit as regime transitions to BEAR.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low-volatility NEUTRAL regimes lack momentum to absorb shock events. Failure to recover quickly indicates structural selling, not noise. Regulatory shocks have lasting impact due to uncertainty, often triggering BEAR transitions.
entry_conditions: Regime = NEUTRAL, BTC 20-day realized volatility < 40th percentile
Major regulatory/crypto-specific headline (verified by news sentiment score <-0.7)
BTC drops >6% within 2 hours of headline
Price fails to recover >50% of drop within 24 hours
Retracement bounce reaches 0.382-0.5 Fibonacci of the drop

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 78.6% Fib extension of initial drop OR regime = BEAR
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reclaims 61.8% Fib retracement (strong reversal invalid)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price fully recovers to pre-shock levels within 5 days in >60% of cases, OR regime remains NEUTRAL without transitioning to BEAR.
